  • Method Details

    • compare

      public Match compare(List<StateImage> imgs, StateImage img2)
      Compare all StateImage objects in the 1st parameter with the StateImage in the 2nd parameter. The Match returned is the best match found, or no match when there are none.
      Parameters:
      imgs - a list of images
      img2 - the image to compare
      Returns:
      the best match

    • compare

      public Match compare(StateImage img1, StateImage img2)
      The largest of img1 and img2 will become the scene. We want to know how img2 compares with img1, so the Match returned will have details for img2 and the match score.
      Parameters:
      img1 - the base image
      img2 - the comparing image
      Returns:
      a Match of img2 with the similarity score

    • compare

      public Match compare(Pattern p1, Pattern p2)
      Comparing images is subjective. This will need various options in the ActionOptions to take care of the different ways to compare. For example, is an image contained multiple times in another larger image more or less similar than an image of the same size but with no direct matches? This base case is built for simplicity and will return the best match of one image in another.
      Parameters:
      p1 - the base image
      p2 - the image to compare
      Returns:
      a Match with the smaller image as the searchImage and the larger image as the Scene.
